snippet.textDisplay:
I remember when my mom had a bunch of spirit flowers sucking her life away making he go to egypt with my grandpa, his egyptian friend, a frenchman and my school buddy to Egypt to kill a vampire that gave me a magical punching ghost that can also stop time.

Good times

snippet.textDisplay: @XxlionesxX Depend on specs? my laptop can run latest PC games on optimum setting without any lag, No$gba emulator rarely lags but desemu lags like hell while recording and that is not cool, anyway I am talking about portability you can't pop out your High spec laptop during a boring lecture and play castlevania, NDS allows that to happen ;)

snippet.textDisplay:
@redwaller66 Not really, it's like Castlevania... it's a sidescroller/platformer and illusion of gaia if i remember correctly (I haven't played that game in like 10 years) is sort of a top down view, more like the early zelda games. This game, aside from some cosmetic diffrences and controlling two characters, is just another in a long string of DS Symphony of the Night remakes. 

So no, this game isn't very similar in story, theme or gameplay. But thanks for reminding me of that great old game!
snippet.textOriginal:
@redwaller66 Not really, it's like Castlevania... it's a sidescroller/platformer and illusion of gaia if i remember correctly (I haven't played that game in like 10 years) is sort of a top down view, more like the early zelda games. This game, aside from some cosmetic diffrences and controlling two characters, is just another in a long string of DS Symphony of the Night remakes. 

So no, this game isn't very similar in story, theme or gameplay. But thanks for reminding me of that great old game!

snippet.textDisplay: Haha, you're right.  I don't know why I've thought this whole time it was Koshiro, as I'm sure I read it somewhere.  Oh well, great track nonetheless.
snippet.textOriginal: Haha, you're right.  I don't know why I've thought this whole time it was Koshiro, as I'm sure I read it somewhere.  Oh well, great track nonetheless.

snippet.textDisplay: Nope, Yuzo Koshiro composed 5 tracks for this game: Dance of Sadness, The Gears Go Awry, Invitation of a Crazed Moon, Banquet of Madness and Destroyer. The others are Yamane's work.
snippet.textOriginal: Nope, Yuzo Koshiro composed 5 tracks for this game: Dance of Sadness, The Gears Go Awry, Invitation of a Crazed Moon, Banquet of Madness and Destroyer. The others are Yamane's work.
